page.title: 07ALL SAINTS' CHURCH,SALPERTON
page.content: The church is set on raised ground to the S of the Manor House and churchgoers have to cross the front of the mansion to reach the old rusty gate and stone steps which lead up to the churchyard.Some interesting Tabletombs can be seen here and one or two have tall iron railings around the graves. The church has a Perpendicular Tower with noteworthy gargoyles,one of which is 'Eve' with the apple in her open mouth.The Tower clock dated 1659 has no hands.Inside there is seating for about 70 people.Services are held alternate Sundays.On the west wall there is a painting of a skeleton holding an arrow and scythe,probably 'Father Time'.
